channel.title: Kata – Agile Staffordshire
channel.description: A user group for Agile, XP, Software Craftsmanship and Software Development, based in Stafford

item.title: August – The Guilded Rose Kata
item.dc:creator: paulswilliams
item.description: Date: Thursday 28th August 2014Time: 19:00Venue: Staffordshire University – Stafford Campus (Octagon building, K102) The Guilded Rose Kata fictionalizes the experience of working with someone else’s code. You’ll probably groan when you first see the code provided to you. The amount of code isn’t overwhelming, its the prefect balance to evoke the feeling, “I can’t wait to re-write this cruft.” It’s suggested […]

item.title: June 2014 – Is TDD Dead?
item.dc:creator: Jon Willis
item.description: Date: Thursday 26th June 2014 Time: 19:00 Venue: Staffordshire University – Stafford Campus (Octagon building, K102) Fear not, TDD is not dead, although it’s certainly been talked to death this month. This catchy title has been doing the rounds on the web recently since the Kent Beck + Martin Fowler + David Heinemeier Hansson talks. This month we are going to […]

item.title: Anagram Kata (Strikes Back)
item.dc:creator: Trevor Adams
item.description: Date: Thursday 27th March 2014 Time: 19:00 Venue: Staffordshire University – Stafford Campus (Octagon building, K102) March is all about code kata. We shall be visiting a kata that has been run before – Anagram! If you do not know what code kata is, start with Dave’s Blog and then read his anagram kata post. We like change, so consider […]

item.title: January 2014 – Kata with Constraints
item.dc:creator: Jon Willis
item.description: Date: Thursday 23rd January 2014 Time: 7:00pm Venue: Staffordshire University – Stafford Campus (Octagon building, K102) With the new year now behind us, to kick start 2014 Agile Staffordshire will be going back to basics with a twist. A key technique in agile development is Test Driven Development (TDD), a difficult skill to master yet often practiced through simple Kata […]

item.title: November 2013 – Brooklyn Beta and Testing with C
item.dc:creator: Trevor Adams
item.description: Date: Thursday 28th November 2013 Time: 7:00pm Venue: Staffordshire University – Stafford Campus (K102 – the Octagon building) Brooklyn Beta is a friendly web conference aimed at the “work hard and be nice to people” crowd. Trevor Adams, a long time member of Agile Staffordshire, attended the event and will be presenting a short talk […]

item.title: January 2013 – Refactoring legacy code
item.dc:creator: paulswilliams
item.description: Date: Thursday 31st January 2013 Time: 7:30pm start Venue: The Stafford Ale House Location: Google Maps Why Refactoring? Well, a Happy New Year to one and all! Over the last few sessions, we’ve discussed The Alien Invasion project muted for 2013 – this project aims to change the implementation of the original Alien Invasion Challenge to support language […]

item.title: September 2012 – Anagram Follow Up
item.dc:creator: Trevor Adams
item.description: Date: Wednesday 26 September 2012 Time: 19:30 start. Venue: The Stafford Ale House Location: Google Map It’s a follow up session! Bring your laptops and other programming apparatus. Last month we had a great session with the Anagram Kata. This month, we shall follow up with some interesting turns involving the same Kata. We shall […]

item.title: August 2012 – Kata: Anagrams
item.dc:creator: Trevor Adams
item.description: Date: Thursday 30th August 2012 Time: 19:30 start. Venue: The Stafford Ale House Location: Google Maps Bring your laptops and your favourite coding tools! This week shall do some coding. I am going to use another kata from Dave Thomas’ Blog; Anagrams! Taken Directly: The challenge is fairly simple: given a file containing one word per […]
